intro: Rhinanthus facchinii, commonly known as the Italian flame flower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Orobanchaceae family. It is an annual herbaceous plant characterized by its bright orange-red flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant is native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa, often growing in disturbed soils and open habitats. Its flowers are tubular and arranged in dense spikes, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Rhinanthus facchinii plays a role in ecological systems by supporting pollinator populations and contributing to biodiversity in its native range.
